title: LLVM abort with codegen-units=2
body:
I wanted to see if Cargo could compile with codegen-units > 0, but unfortunately it can't :(

```
$ git clone https://github.com/rust-lang/term
$ cd term
$ git reset --hard 6822aed1980f572f5d241c7bacf6971b5e2775ed
$ cargo rustc -- -C codegen-units=2
    Updating registry `https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io-index`
   Compiling term v0.2.7 (file:///home/alex/code/term)
Global is external, but doesn't have external or weak linkage!
Global is external, but doesn't have external or weak linkage!
void (%"1.std::sync::mutex::MutexGuard<()>"*, %closure.0*, i8)* @"_ZN4sync5mutex37MutexGuard$LT$$u27$mutex$C$$u20$T$GT$3new12closure.5904E"
invalid linkage type for function declaration
i8 (i64, i8*)* @"_ZN4iter30Map$LT$I$C$$u20$F$GT$.Iterator4next12closure.8250E"
invalid linkage type for function declaration
void (%"1.std::sync::mutex::MutexGuard<()>"*, %closure.0*, i8)* @"_ZN4sync5mutex37MutexGuard$LT$$u27$mutex$C$$u20$T$GT$3new12closure.5904E"
i8 (i64, i8*)* @"_ZN4iter30Map$LT$I$C$$u20$F$GT$.Iterator4next12closure.8250E"
Global is external, but doesn't have external or weak linkage!
LLVM ERROR: Broken module found, compilation aborted!
Could not compile `term`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

Note that the Cargo I'm using is a nightly cargo which has the `cargo rustc` command.

cc @nrc
